title: Pepper
description: Pepper is a semi-humanoid robot manufactured by SoftBank Robotics (formerly Aldebaran Robotics), which is owned by SoftBank, designed with the ability to read emotions.

title: Sophia
description: Sophia is a social humanoid robot developed by Hong Kong-based company Hanson Robotics.Sophia became the first robot to receive citizenship of any country.

title: Milo
description: Milo is a humanoid robot designed to teach social skills to children with autism. He has an autism specific curriculum that is interactive, engaging and fun.

title: Deka
description: Bionic limbs have also emerged as an exciting area of robotic technology – aiding people who’ve been born without limbs or who’ve lost them in accidents. The DEKA Arm is just one one such example

title: Jibo
description: While it would be nice to have a robot that can organise your home office and ensure your children are ready for school, that’s a long way off. However, Jibo is an excellent example of how robots can become our personal assistants.

title: Double
description: Double is the next best thing. It’s essentially a stick with motorised wheels and a screen attached to it, letting you move around spaces and attend events from the comfort of your own home

title: SpotMini
description: A nimble robot that handles objects, climbs stairs, and will operate in offices, homes and outdoors.

title: Robear
description: Robear is a nursing-care robot developed by the RIKEN-SRK in Japan. The idea behind the robot was to help people, particularly the elderly, regain some independence.

title: LG Rolling Bot
description: LG’s Rolling Bot could be set to revolutionise your home. Styled like the BB-8 Droid, it’s a Wi-Fi-based security bot that you can roll around your house remotely.
